product_name: KissFalscara Special Edition Starter Kit, Lash Clusters, Lengthening Wisps
summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackFALSCARA Special Edition Starter Kit comes with everything you need for a DIY "under lash" eyelash extensions look, now with 36 lash wisps, a 50% increased value! Kiss's FALSCARA wisps are eyelash clusters that go under your own lashes, so the bands aren't visible.
details: DetailsFeaturesDIY lash extensions stay secure & comfortable for 24 hours or up to 14 days with Overnighter long wear sealerWater resistant wisps are rewearable up to 3x with quick & easy removal that wonâ€™t damage your natural lashesUnique flexible microband with featherlight fibers goes under your own lashes for a seamless, natural look & no visible bandCustomize your look with stackable, buildable lash wisps â€“ wear them any way you want to fit your personal styleIncludes36 Lengthening black lash clusters, with a sporty style, 10mm-14mm, natural volume, & rounded shapeTweezers - for optimal wisp placementLash Adhesive And Sealer (0.15 oz each) - preps your lashes and hold the wisps in place, ergonomically designed, nonstick, precisionOvernighter long wear sealer, (0.18 oz) - holds lashes in place for up to 14 daysFalse Eyelash Wisps and Bond & Seal Remover (1.69 oz) -rosewater infused, gentle formulaItem 2625141How To UseDo not apply mascara before or after FALSCARA.Step 1: Brush a light coat of BOND on natural lashes. A little goes a long way!Step 2: Use the APPLICATOR to pluck a WISP from the tray. As shown, pick up a WISP from the middle-outer end for optimal control. One by one, gently place the WISPS underneath the base of your natural lashes, slightly away from the waterline. Apply wisps starting from the outer corner of lash line, working inwards (or vice versa). Place WISPS right next to each other for a seamless look.Step 3: Dab a thin coat of SEAL under WISPS to eliminate any sticky residue and hold WISPS in place. Pro tips: If needed, after applying SEAL under WISPS, use the APPLICATOR or your fingers to squeeze the WISPS against your natural lashes; this helps the WISPS adhere for a more secure hold.TO REMOVE:â€¢ Saturate a cotton pad with FALSCARA REMOVER (sold separately) or oil-free makeup remover.â€¢ Place pad over eyes for 10 seconds, then gently wipe or peel off WISPS and BOND & SEAL.TO REUSE WISPS:â€¢ Place used WISPS on a paper towel, coat with FALSCARA REMOVER or oil-free makeup remover, then let sit for 10 seconds.â€¢ Saturate a cotton swab with remover and gently wipe away BOND & SEAL residue from the WISPS. Store WISPS in original packaging.Precautions: KEEP OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDRENIngredientsBOND: Acrylates/Ethylhexyl Acrylate Copolymer, Butylene Glycol, Alcohol Denat., Water, AMP-Acrylates Copolymer, Phenoxyethanol, Citric Acid, Sodium Carbonate, Sorbitol, Ceteareth-25, Ethylhexylglycerin, Urea, Disodium Phosphate, Biotin, Black 2.; SEAL: Isododecane, Water, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, VP/Eicosene Copolymer, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Wax, Ceresin, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, VP/VA Copolymer, Panthenol, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, PEG-60 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Phenoxyethanol, Polypropylsilsesquioxane, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Tocopheryl Acetate.; OVERNIGHTER: Water (Aqua), Acrylates/Ethylhexyl Acrylate Copolymer, Acrylates Copolymer, Alcohol Denat., Butylene Glycol, Propylene Glycol, Alcohol, Cellulose Gum, Phenoxyethanol, Glycerin, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Isopropyl Alcohol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Laureth-21, PEG-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Black 2 (CI 77266).; REMOVER: Isododecane, Water (Aqua),Dimethicone, Dipropylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Sodium Chloride, Butylene Glycol, Caprylyl/Capryl Glucoside, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Benzophenone-5, Disodium EDTA, Paeonia Suffruticosa Root Extract, Tromethamine, Red 40 (CI 16035).
how_to_use: Do not apply mascara before or after FALSCARA.Step 1: Brush a light coat of BOND on natural lashes. A little goes a long way!Step 2: Use the APPLICATOR to pluck a WISP from the tray. As shown, pick up a WISP from the middle-outer end for optimal control. One by one, gently place the WISPS underneath the base of your natural lashes, slightly away from the waterline. Apply wisps starting from the outer corner of lash line, working inwards (or vice versa). Place WISPS right next to each other for a seamless look.Step 3: Dab a thin coat of SEAL under WISPS to eliminate any sticky residue and hold WISPS in place. Pro tips: If needed, after applying SEAL under WISPS, use the APPLICATOR or your fingers to squeeze the WISPS against your natural lashes; this helps the WISPS adhere for a more secure hold.TO REMOVE:â€¢ Saturate a cotton pad with FALSCARA REMOVER (sold separately) or oil-free makeup remover.â€¢ Place pad over eyes for 10 seconds, then gently wipe or peel off WISPS and BOND & SEAL.TO REUSE WISPS:â€¢ Place used WISPS on a paper towel, coat with FALSCARA REMOVER or oil-free makeup remover, then let sit for 10 seconds.â€¢ Saturate a cotton swab with remover and gently wipe away BOND & SEAL residue from the WISPS. Store WISPS in original packaging.Precautions: KEEP OUT OF THE REACH OF CHILDREN

reviews.headline: Beware - lashes impossible to remove from packaging
reviews.comments: I'm not sure if I got a bad batch, but I bought this kit a few months ago and when I went to remove the lashes from the package being very delicate and careful they all fell apart. It didn't matter if I use my fingers lightly or some tweezers or if I picked it up at the base of the lash gently or at the side of it - the actual lashes would just crumble off of the base of the false lash. My entire package is full of disintegrated lashes due to not being able to get them out of the package and now I have an eyelash full of glue and nothing to do with it very disappointing and I wish I could get a refund.

reviews.headline: Do not buy
reviews.comments: I am very disappointed.

reviews.headline: These suck.
reviews.comments: I have NOTHING but bad things to say about these lash clusters. They absolutely suck. Ive never had lash clusters that fall of so easily. The glue sucks, they dont even last overnight. The curl falls out of them so easily, and it makes them look droppy and stupid. I've tried so many methods ive seen on tiktok  to make them last. They dont work AT ALL. The only good thing about theese is the tweezers they come with. Don't waste your money on these.

reviews.headline: The lashes shed and glue doesn't hold
reviews.comments:
I am an experienced lash user and I wanted to try something new.  The lashes are very firmly glued into the packaging so it's difficult to even get them out.  The hairs fall out during removal, during application, and during wear.  I don't understand the point of the two step glue when the first step isn't enough to hold the lashes in place and the second step doesn't dry.   So i had shedding and goopy clusters that were not secure.  
I've used to kiss lashes before and liked them, but this kit was a complete failure

reviews.headline: Don't waste your money
reviews.comments: I put them on for an event i was going to, and wantes then to last the rest of the week. (It says 14 days, so 7 days should be fine). They didnt even last 14 hours. I was outside for like 10 mins, and they started to adhere to my lower lashes. Then while i was taking my eyeliner off (very gently) they all just slipped off. I would not recommend

reviews.headline: Lashes fall apart at grab
reviews.comments:
These lashes falls apart as you grab them out of the box. 

Why? How?

reviews.headline: Super Easy and No Fumes!
reviews.comments:
These are hands down the easiest at-home lash extensions I've used. The bond is simple to apply, has no strong fumes, and the lashes stick effortlessly. The whole process is quick and beginner friendly, and the results look amazing.

My only complaints are the wear time and how delicate the lashes are. You have to be super careful removing them from the tray or they can fall apart. Still, for the price and convenience, these are a go-to!

reviews.headline: Super Easy and No Fumes!
reviews.comments:
These are hands down the easiest at-home lash extensions I've used. The bond is simple to apply, has no strong fumes, and the lashes stick effortlessly. The whole process is quick and beginner friendly, and the results look amazing.

My only complaints are the wear time and how delicate the lashes are. You have to be super careful removing them from the tray or they can fall apart. Still, for the price and convenience, these are a go-to!

reviews.headline: DO NOT GET THIS
reviews.comments: I have very long lashes and after i used this FOR ONE NIGHT i sleeped with it for one night and what happendâ€¦ MY LASHES FELL OFF I AM SOOOO MAD OMG MY LASHES ARE TINY NOT LONG

reviews.headline: do not get these
reviews.comments: i bought this kit very excited thinking that since it had this remover, glue, and overnight seal it was going to be amazingâ€¦but it was not i opened it and started to grab at the lash with the lash placer and immediately all the little singular lashes ripped off one by one, i thought it was weird so i grabbed at another and it did the same thing over and over again, i got so frustrated i iust threw all the lashes away. Not to mentoion the glue and the remover is also terrible. I wish that i read more into the reviews.

reviews.headline: Love Falscara lashes
reviews.comments: Absolutely love these. I use strip lashes all the time. I heard about these & thought I'd try them out. Absolutely love them. I apply them at my desk at work for the day & so very easy. It even looks like I've used eyeliner but I haven't. I highly recommend. I don't use the overnight bond (for extended use). I remove them at the end of the day, every day. You *do* have to use an eye makeup remover. But very easy for me to remove. Love these!!

reviews.headline: I thought I'd like this but I don't
reviews.comments: Honestly, I've applied so many different types of false eyelashes and these are one of the worst. It's clumped all of my eyelashes together and they don't stick and it just screws your eyes together. It's just a pain!

reviews.headline: Don't buy !
reviews.comments: Lashes look great when they are put on, but the sale does not work nor does the bond and the overnight. The seal is oily so it pulls the lashes off.

reviews.headline: Easy to use and lightweight
reviews.comments: I was pleasantly surprised by these. They're easy to use, lightweight, and look great!

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: Love using these instead of having to get lash extensions done

reviews.headline: Don't recommend
reviews.comments: Ive done my lashes before and ive never had so many of my natural lashes come out with thr fake lashes that dont last longer than 2 days (no matter how you apply). Through each of my uses of this kit ive lost about 7 natural lashes per eye during removal (even when the falsies fall off by themselves).

reviews.headline: Birthday gift
reviews.comments: My granddaughter, who is a freshman, absolutely loved it!

reviews.headline: Maybe it's a faulty batch
reviews.comments: I have been doing my lashes at home for years and I swear ive used this same kit before, in a different state than I live in now, but the lashes are breaking off when im barely pulling them off the packaging? Makes no sense this is the worst lash kit ive ever bought. May just be a bad batch, but im worried ill just be returning the next kit as wellâ€¦. Ulta is giving me a refund thankfully, kiss needs to do better this was awful.

reviews.headline: Save your money and do not buy.
reviews.comments: I saw this product all over Youtube and I wanted to try it out. I followed all the instructions and watched countless tutorials. These lashes severely irritated my eyes and the bond did not work very well and I had to add a substantial amount before the lashes started to actually stick. I am not one to return used products, but this was a total waste of my money. Bottom line, save your time and money.

reviews.headline: pretty good!
reviews.comments: definitely good for starting off. i think most of the people who reviewed this product didnt do it right. practice makes perfect!!! keep trying to work with these!! i just wish they stayed on longer and didnt start to fall off after a day.

media.headline: Beware - lashes impossible to remove from packaging
Worst lashes ever!!!
media.caption: Like they were acc falling out

media.headline: Would not buy these lashes again

faceoff_positive.comments:
I gave this product a month before I wrote a review. This review is especially for hooded older eyes. I have had eyelash extensions for at least 4 YEARS or more, going every 3 weeks for fills so I have not seen the state of my scant Asian natural lashes for a very long time. So I will break down this product and use after seeing my lack of natural lashes and using strip lashes for about a month to help the regrowth. I figured this would be easier in my daily routine than strip lashes when I saw other reviews that it can last up to10 days.
Pros:
A lot lighter in weight and feel that both strip lashes and lash extensions
Does not affect the growth of natural lashes either in application or removal
Cost is so much cheaper than lash extensions and fills
Time taken to apply is a lot less than going to get lash extensions
Looks less "heavy" on the lid than strip lashes as I don't wear eyeliner
Looks more natural than a strip lash
There is no pull on the lid to remove like when you have to remove a strip lash
Lasted me 10-14 days so there is no daily application like with strip lashes
Cons:
Takes me more time to apply than strip lashes (but then again I don't have to do it daily)
The bond is sticky and can stick to upper skin and the seal leaves a white residue on the lashes
The lashes in this kit broke apart when trying to remove it from the package. Others complained about it so I was ultra careful and lost almost 40% of the lash clusters before I decided to take the lash remover that the kit came with and a qtip, gently rubbed the band of the cluster and it came off easily. The multi pack with extra lashes only (sold separately) does not have this issue.
Application for hooded mature eyes:
Clean eyelashes thoroughly. I used a gentle toner on a cotton pad
Curl lashes
Apply bond sparingly like mascara one section at a time
Wait for it to get tacky. Meanwhile you can take the eyelash tool provided and swipe the seal on it so the lash does not stick to it
Pick up a lash cluster and apply. Use a mirror angled under your chin for best results
For the bond not to stick to my hooded eyelid I use a qtip soaked in remover pressed against the crease of my eyelid. This also helps put the underside of the lashes more exposed for application.
Immediately clamp the lash and natural lashes together tightly. Wipe the tool from any bond and continue the process.
The entire process for both eyes takes me 15 mins.
The day after, apply the overnighter on the base of the eyelashes. I believe this is what made my lashes last for 10-14 days
Removal:
Take a qtip soaked in remover and gently brush it on lashes with eyes closed. Lashes come off quite easily. You can take the bond off the lashes the same way and complete the process with a pad soaked in toner.
The product lost one star because 50% of the lashes were destroyed in removal. Also because the seal leaves a white residue on the lashes.
Notes: a cluster has come loose now and then (especially after sleep) and it takes less than a minute to reapply bond and reattach

Overall I am very happy with the product as it is easy enough in application although there is a little learning curve as with any lash product. It is definitely a great alternative cost and time wise to getting lash extensions. Also the regrowth of my natural lashes has been a big plus.
faceoff_positive.headline: Buy the overnight applicator or elseâ€¦.

faceoff_negative.comments:
TheÂ Kiss Falscara Starter KitÂ is a great beginner-friendly kit that comes with everything you need to get started, making the whole process feel a little less intimidating. 

TheÂ instructions were very clear and simple - just swipe on the bond, place the lashes, then swipe on the seal - making it easy to manage. That being said, I had more issues than success. 

The lashes themselves were great. They're soft and don't feel heavy, but after the 4th or 5th attempt, I had mixed feelings about the bond itself. The bond has a tacky texture that made my natural lashes clump together, leaving the final look nonuniform and less natural than I hoped for. Instead of a seamless lash line, it looked a bit messy and uneven in parts. 

TheÂ application tweezer also gave me some trouble. It felt slippery and kept shifting the angle of the lashes I was trying to apply. I found myself squeezing extra hard just to make sure I was holding the lashes well, but I was also scared I would crease them too much. The tweezer was also a bit chunky and got in the way, making it difficult to calculate where I was placing the lashes. In the end, it was easier for me to use my fingers to apply the lashes more precisely. 

Removing the lashes was fairly simple when using the removal oil included in the kit. I dabbed a bit of the oil on one finger, rubbed my fingers together, then held the lashes gently between them for a few seconds before they slid right off. 

Cleaning the lashesÂ was basically the same process. I used a small amount of remover and rubbed it along the lashes to get rid of any leftover bond or seal. Just be sure to clean themÂ right afterÂ removing them. If you wait too long, the residue gunks up and the lashes can become clumpy, which can cause eye irritation or infection if you try using them again.

Overall, theÂ kit is great if you're new to lashes, but you might want to explore other application tools or bonding formulas for better results. I will continue to try and hope that one of these days, I get it right....
faceoff_negative.headline: Sectional lashes are not for me...
